original_table_html:
FIGURE 5-5
Services Provided by Channel Members
Source: Reprinted from Donald Lehmann and Russell Winer, Product Management, 2nd ed (Burr Ridge, IL: Irwin, 1997), Figure 13-8 on p. 379. Â© The McGraw-Hill Companies.
summary_markdown: This figure illustrates the various services that channel members provide, categorized into three main groups: those that facilitate the exchange process, those that facilitate the physical distribution process, and those that facilitate facilitating functions. Exchange process services include information gathering and dissemination, promotion, negotiation, and ordering. Physical distribution services encompass matching buyers and sellers, physical handling, and storage. Facilitating functions include financing and risk-taking. These services collectively contribute to the efficient functioning of the marketing channel by bridging the gap between producers and consumers.
